alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 7:33AM MDT until May 22 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Below Tierra Amarilla affecting Rio Arriba County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect an extremely full river with overbank flow in low lying areas downstream. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...High flows caused by upstream dam release is expected. * WHERE...Rio Chama below Tierra Amarilla. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM MDT Thursday was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain at 6.3 feet through monday. - Action stage is 6.2 feet. - Flood stage is 6.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1000 PM MDT.
